title: Nitish Kumar chosen leader of NDA in Bihar; set to take oath as CM for record 10th time
text:
JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar was chosen leader of the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in Bihar during a meeting of newly-elected MLAs of the alliance partners on Wednesday, state minister Shrawon Kumar said.

The proposal for the leader of NDA was moved by JD(U)â€™s Vijay Choudhary and seconded by BJP leaders Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Sinha. MLAs of the LJP(RV), HAM and RLM also seconded the proposal, Shrawon Kumar said.
